subject: Maybe there is only one box user allowed!?
author: Frank Sumption
full_text:
--_ca1d38b6-1c60-4f2b-a948-ee1389491794_
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="Windows-1252"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable


"Christopher was immediately taken by what he had seen and heard. He was a=
ble to > make a direct connection with spirits. inhabitants, victims, parti=
cipants, and > witnesses...describing amazing events and even some unspeaka=
ble acts that had > happened within the walls of these notoriously haunted =
places. The details > afforded by these spirits gave answers to lingering q=
uestions that could not > have come from anyone but the parties involved. A=
lready amazed by the > instrument's ability to connect with these historica=
l figures, Christopher soon > realized that other entities were trying to r=
each out as well. Deceased fathers, > sons, mothers, daughters, and friends=
 of session participants were sending > messages through the device. Talk o=
f this spread, and last year, at the Ghost > Chaser's Weekend Conference in=
 Savannah, Georgia, Christopher was asked to do a > presentation about his =
research with the Telephone to the Dead. This quickly > turned into an impr=
omtu public demonstration, with participants, one by one, > coming forward =
requesting to speak with loved ones who had died. Surprisingly, > even to C=
hristopher, these requests were met with comforting and sometimes vital > m=
essages. The presentation was recorded and broadcasted by A.P.S.R. Radio."
=
 
 From a recent add for another presentation, but apparently the rest of u=
s get nothing like this, so it doesn't even work for us. Guess I'll just go=
 back to killing time wth Ham radio, and quit wasting all my time and money=
 on useless boxes. 
 
 Curious that no one else gets any "real" contacts--e=
vent the so called box inventor gets nothing.
 
 
 Frank-S

"Christopher was immediately taken by what he had seen and hear=
d. He was able to <BR>> make a direct connection with spirits. inhabitan=
ts, victims, participants, and <BR>> witnesses...describing amazing even=
ts and even some unspeakable acts that had <BR>> happened within the wal=
ls of these notoriously haunted places. The details <BR>> afforded by th=
ese spirits gave answers to lingering questions that could not <BR>> hav=
e come from anyone but the parties involved. Already amazed by the <BR>>=
 instrument's ability to connect with these historical figures, Christopher=
 soon <BR>> realized that other entities were trying to reach out as wel=
l. Deceased fathers, <BR>> sons, mothers, daughters, and friends of sess=
ion participants were sending <BR>> messages through the device. Talk of=
 this spread, and last year, at the Ghost <BR>> Chaser's Weekend Confere=
nce in Savannah, Georgia, Christopher was asked to do a <BR>> presentati=
on about his research with the Telephone to the Dead. This quickly <BR>>=
 turned into an impromtu public demonstration, with participants, one by on=
e, <BR>> coming forward requesting to speak with loved ones who had died=
. Surprisingly, <BR>> even to Christopher, these requests were met with =
comforting and sometimes vital <BR>> messages. The presentation was reco=
rded and broadcasted by A.P.S.R. Radio."<BR>
 <BR>
 From a recent=
 add for another presentation, but apparently the rest of us get nothing li=
ke this, so it doesn't even work for us. Guess I'll just go back to killing=
 time wth Ham radio, and quit wasting all my time and money on useless=
 boxes. <BR>
 <BR>
 Curious that no one else gets any "real" cont=
acts--event the so called box inventor gets nothing.<BR>
